text: Greek Chicken Souvlaki Recipe with Tzatziki
label: title

text: Ingredients
label: header

text: 10 garlic cloves, peeled
label: ingredient

text: 2 tbsp dried oregano
label: ingredient

text: 1 tsp dried rosemary
label: ingredient

text: 1 tsp sweet paprika
label: ingredient

text: 1 tsp each Kosher salt and black pepper
label: ingredient

text: 1/4 cup Private Reserve Greek extra virgin olive oil
label: ingredient

text: 1/4 cup dry white wine
label: ingredient

text: Juice of 1 lemon
label: ingredient

text: 2 bay leaves
label: ingredient

text: 2 1/2 lb organic boneless skinless chicken breast, fat removed, cut into 1 1/2 inch pieces
label: ingredient

text: Greek pita bread
label: ingredient

text: Tzatziki Sauce (make according to this recipe)
label: ingredient

text: Sliced tomato, cucumber, onions, and Kalamata olives
label: ingredient

text: Greek salad recipe
label: junk

text: Roasted Garlic Hummus
label: junk

text: Mezze Platter
label: junk

text: Watermelon and Cucumber Salad
label: junk

text: Instructions
label: header

text: Prepare the marinade. In the bowl of a small food processor, add garlic, oregano, rosemary, paprika, salt, pepper, olive oil, white wine, and lemon juice (do NOT add the dried bay leaves yet). Pulse until well combined.
label: step

text: Place chicken in a large bowl and add bay leaves. Top with marinade. Toss to combine, making sure chicken is well-coated with marinade. cover tightly and refrigerate for 2 hours or overnight (see note for quicker marinating option.)
label: step

text: Soak 10 to 12 wooden skewers in water for 30 to 45 minutes or so. Prepare Tzatziki sauce and other fixings, and if you’re adding Greek salad or other sides, prepare those as well. (some sides like roasted garlic hummus may take longer, you can prepare those in advance).
label: step

text: When ready, thread marinated chicken pieces through the prepared skewers.
label: step

text: Prepare outdoor grill (or griddle). Brush grates with a little oil and heat over medium-high heat. t. Place chicken skewers on grill (or cook in batches on griddle) until well browned and internal temperature registers 160°F on instant read thermometer (it will continue cooking to 165°F as it rests). Be sure to turn skewers evenly to cook on all sides, about 5 minutes total. (Adjust temperature of grill if necessary). While grilling, brush lightly with the marinade (then discard any left marinade).
label: step

text: Transfer chicken to serving platter and let rest for 3 minutes. Meanwhile, briefly grill pitas and keep warm.
label: step

text: Assemble grilled chicken souvlaki pitas. First, spread Tzatziki sauce on pita, add chicken pieces (take them off skewers first, of course) then add veggies and olives.
label: step

text: Optional: if you want more items to add to your buffet, consider Greek salad, watermelon salad, roasted garlic hummus, or a big Mezze platter.
label: step
